snippet: To the Editor:    It's only in the context of Al Checchi's Godzilla-sized spending that you can interpret the California Democratic gubernatorial primary as ''a rejection of checkbook politics and unrestricted spending'' (editorial, June 4). Lieut...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: It's only in the context of Al Checchi's Godzilla-sized spending that you can interpret the California Democratic gubernatorial primary as ''a rejection of checkbook politics and unrestricted spending'' (editorial, June 4). Lieut. Gov. Gray Davis, the winner, who raised at least $9 million for his campaign -- normally a whopping sum, ran successfully by saying that his years in office gave him ''experience money can't buy.'' But he also told The Los Angeles Times that ''I'm personal friends with virtually all my large contributors.''
abstract: Public Campaign senior analyst Micah L Sifry letter comments on June 4 editorial; contends that it is only in context of Al Checchi's Godzilla-sized spending that you can interpret California Democratic gubernatorial primary as 'rejection of checkbook politics and unrestricted spending'
